alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Northern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Wyoming, northeastern Erie and southwestern Genesee Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alden, or near Clarence, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Depew, Lancaster, Darien Lakes State Park, Elma, Marilla, Pembroke, Akron, Alden, Elma Center, Billington Heights, Corfu and Cowlesville. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 48A. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
